titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Samuel Barker papers, 1848-1876
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Family correspondence between Quaker settlers in Indiana and relatives in Randolph County, N.C., describing crops, opportunities in the West, commodity prices, and personal matters. Some items mention the Woody family which moved from Guilford County, N.C., to Boone County, Ind. Also included are papers relating to the James Sluder family of Ashe County, N.C., and La Grange, Randolph County. Among the writers is Levi Cox of Randolph County.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the Rubenstein to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Samuel Barker Papers, 1848-1876, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Quaker, resident of Thorntown (Boone County), Ind.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Family correspondence between Quaker settlers in Indiana and relatives in Randolph County, N.C., describing crops, opportunities in the West, commodity prices, and personal matters. Some items mention the Woody family which moved from Guilford County, N.C., to Boone County, Ind. Also included are papers relating to the James Sluder family of Ashe County, N.C., and La Grange, Randolph County. Among the writers is Levi Cox of Randolph County.
